description.value:
Last Blessing
Rite of Death • Level 1

Time: 10 minutes
Cost: 1 Gnosis
Requirement: The intact body or remains of the deceased Garou

Description

The Last Blessing is performed to ensure that a fallen Garou's body returns to a form acceptable to the natural and spiritual order. Through prayer and invocation, the Garou release the corpse from unnatural shapes imposed by death or battle.

This Rite exists to protect the living — not to alter the fate of the dead.

Effect

When the Gnosis cost is paid, the Rite succeeds automatically.

Upon completion:

  • The deceased Garou's body assumes a natural, non-monstrous form (humanoid or animal, as appropriate)
  • Any visible signs of supernatural transformation caused by shapeshifting are removed
  • The body no longer presents as overtly supernatural to mundane observation
  • If the deceased was metis-born, the body instead assumes a natural humanoid or animal form, chosen by the Storyteller to best preserve secrecy and dignity.

This effect is permanent and does not interfere with burial, cremation, or other funerary practices.

Mechanical Clarification

The Rite affects only the physical body. It does not: restore life; preserve the corpse; conceal wounds or cause of death; affect the soul or spirit. The Rite has no effect on bodies already altered by powerful magic (such as true polymorph or resurrection magic).

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Does not prevent divination magic from determining the corpse's true nature
  • Does not interfere with resurrection spells
  • Does not grant protection against necromancy
  • The Rite must be performed within one Caern Turn of the Garou's death to have effect
  • A body may only be affected by this Rite once

"They carried many shapes in life. In death, they carry only one."
